stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream building a new cardboard-themed sub-area inside the Arts-and-Crafts world.  He lays out coloured cardboard platforms that fall when Mario approaches, plans saw-blade hazards that start moving when the player is close, tweaks platform scaling with his in-engine “B Berms”, experiments with textures, and tests overall difficulty.

development_findings.summary: Created a race-style sub-area made of floating cardboard platforms that drop once the player is near; saw blades between platforms will activate on proximity so the player must keep moving.
Platforms use a custom scale field (“B Berms”) so Kaze can change size (and colour) in-engine without new models, fixing previous overflow issues.
development_findings.quote: I have B Berms on the actor and I can change the B Berms to change the scale of the platforms.

development_findings.summary: Decided level is not an autoscroller; it’s a timed race where saws pressure the player.
development_findings.quote: It's not really an autoscroller. It's more like a race.

development_findings.summary: Wants final star on a stable platform; estimates this star will be #4 or #5 for the course.
development_findings.quote: I think the final star should be on a stable platform though, one that doesn't fall.

development_findings.summary: Current floor texture looks bad; considering painted look but worries about repetition. May dynamically generate vertices / UVs to solve stretching.
Abandoned idea to render Mario’s hat at half size only on emulator to appear crisper; looked bad and he refuses adding an option.
development_findings.quote: I think it looks like shit, so I'm not adding this.

development_findings.summary: Encountered occlusion-plane and underflow warnings while compiling for N64; suspects most are emulator bugs and is ignoring them for now.
Frustrated with Parallel Launcher emulator (controls fail, coins not rendered); reverted to old setup.
development_findings.quote: What a garbage ass I'm going to play.

development_findings.summary: Projected speed-run times: any% ~80–85 min, 100% ~3–3.5 hrs; intends to limit BLJs and similar skips so runs stay recognisable.
development_findings.quote: As soon as the game becomes unrecognisable from how the casual gameplay goes, the speedrun is not fun anymore.

development_findings.summary: Course-1 public demo still planned; will hide a fully playable Delfino Plaza on N64 inside that demo.
development_findings.quote: I'm probably also gonna just randomly throw in Delfino Plaza on the N64 into the demo so you can play it if you unlock it.

development_findings.summary: Considering a future open-world Mario 64 project but doubts he’ll have time.
Objects that rotate or move are expensive on N64; wherever possible he bakes visuals into level geometry and keeps only logic in actors.

context_findings.summary: Passion priority: making the game first, YouTube videos only as revenue stream; he drops projects that don’t get views.
context_findings.quote: The first [priority] is making my video game and the second is making money. Making YouTube videos… that’s just a way to make money.

context_findings.summary: Skeptical of offering many configuration options; prefers firm design choices.
context_findings.quote: Because I'm not adding options for every little baby thing. Less options is better, don't you ask me.

context_findings.summary: Expressed ongoing frustration with emulator incompatibilities; emotional spikes when software fails.
Mentions daily routine: starts work while Zeina is still in bed.
context_findings.quote: Zeina takes so long out of bed that after we get up, I go down and I start working and then we eat because she's out of bed now.

context_findings.summary: Lighthearted personal note: plans to dress his baby as a Pikmin for Halloween and jokingly ‘throw’ her to carry things.
States budgeting is ‘for poor people’, revealing tongue-in-cheek view on personal finance.
Shows excitement for US election, video memes, and MrBeast April-Fools idea—illustrates playful internet culture engagement.

biobak.summary: Only mention is a viewer praising Biobak’s work; no new detail on current tasks.

zeina.summary: Kaze jokes about Zeina’s slow mornings; no direct discussion of her animation work in this stream.

key_stories.title: Hat Texture Experiment
key_stories.summary: Kaze noticed Mario’s cap looks ‘crusty’ on emulator.  He tried showing a version at half the normal texture size exclusively on emulators.
key_stories.challenge: Improve cap appearance on high-res emulators without affecting N64.
key_stories.process: Programmed conditional rendering: small hat on emulator, original on hardware.
key_stories.outcome: Looked tiny and ‘stupid’; feature scrapped and no option will be offered.
key_stories.key_quote: I think it looks like shit, so I'm not adding this.

key_stories.title: Parallel Launcher Frustration
key_stories.summary: Viewers urged Kaze to adopt Parallel Launcher.  He tested it live but controls failed and coin graphics vanished.
key_stories.process: Switched plugins, showed bugs, compared to Muupen setup.
key_stories.outcome: Declared Parallel Launcher too buggy for now; returned to previous tools.
key_stories.key_quote: What a garbage ass I'm going to play.

key_stories.title: Building the Cardboard Race
key_stories.summary: Designing a falling-platform race area with saw hazards required precise scaling and colour variation.
key_stories.challenge: Avoid geometry overflows while offering size variety.
key_stories.process: Used B Berms scaling, fixed overflow, re-laid platforms, balanced difficulty.
key_stories.outcome: Layout approved; next step is coding saw behaviour and final texture pass.
